meanings.definition: To thrust forward or impose oneself or one's ideas on others.
meanings.sent1: Please do not obtrude your opinions on me.
meanings.sent2: He tends to obtrude himself into every conversation.
meanings.sent3: It can be annoying when people obtrude their beliefs without being asked.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice obtruded into the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors obtruded on the otherwise plain painting.

meanings.definition: To be pushed or forced into a situation or place where one is not wanted or welcome.
meanings.sent1: The unwanted guest obtruded into the private party.
meanings.sent2: She felt obtruded upon by the sudden influx of visitors.
meanings.sent3: The cat obtruded into the room through the open window.
meanings.sent4: The noise from the construction site obtruded on their peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The smell of burnt popcorn obtruded into the movie theater.
